word:
Not that sin might become righteousness and transgression of the law a virtue, did Christ die. He died that sin might be made to appear exceeding sinful, the hateful thing it is. By His death He became the possessor of the keys of hell and of death. Satan could no longer reign without a rival 


                                    -399- 

and be revenged as a god. Temples had been erected to him, and human sacrifices offered on his altars. "They sacrificed to devils."
